summary: A chemo-enzymatic method was developed for the stereoinversion of β-substituted α-amino acids using an amino acid oxidase and a chemical reducing agent, achieving high enantioselectivity.
key_claims: Stereoinversion of b-substituted a-amino acids can be achieved with L-amino acid oxidase and chemical reducing agents like NaBH4 or Pd/C-HCO2NH4.
The process requires 7 cycles to achieve >99% ee with yields between 80-99%.

_title: Stereoinversion of β- and γ-substituted α-amino acids using a chemo-enzymatic oxidation–reduction procedure
_abstract: Both D-and L-b-and g-substituted a-amino acids can be interconverted to their respective L-and D-diastereoisomers by treatment with an enantioselective amino acid oxidase and a chemical reducing agent.
